title: Donald Trump says US forces bombed Iran nuclear sites
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday said that a “very successful attack” on three nuclear sites in Iran had been successfully carried out, including at Fordow.

title: 37 Sri Lankans in Iran, four departed in recent days: MFA
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has issued details of 37 Sri Lankans currently in Iran amidst the ongoing conflict in the Middle East.

title: Sri Lanka appreciates India’s support to evacuate Sri Lankans from Iran
byline: Sri Lanka has extended its gratitude to the government of India for the timely assistance to evacuate Sri Lankans from Iran.

title: First event to honour A/L top performers in Kilinochchi
byline: A programme to recognise high-achieving students who excelled in the recent 2023/2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination at district level has been launched by the President’s Fund.

title: Several spells of showers expected in some places today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts.

title: 31 still receiving treatment following Dunhinda bus accident
byline: A total of 31 individuals, who sustained injuries in yesterday’s bus accident along the Badulla- Mahiyanganaya main road in Dunhinda are still receiving treatment at the Badulla Teaching Hospital, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Services of President’s Fund officially launched at Divisional Secretariat level
byline: The official launch of providing all services of the President’s Fund through Divisional Secretariats across the island has taken place at the Kilinochchi District Secretariat.

title: UN chief ‘gravely alarmed’ by US bombing of Iranian nuclear sites
byline: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday called for the immediate de-escalation of the Israeli-Iranian conflict and for an ensuing ceasefire.

title: Shortage of 42,000 teachers must be addressed urgently - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has emphasized that the current shortage of over 42,000 teachers in national and provincial schools must be urgently addressed.

title: Iranian nuclear facilities “completely and totally obliterated” - Donald Trump
byline: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday (Jun 21) that Iran must now make peace or “we will go after” other targets in Iran, after US strikes that he said “completely and totally obliterated” Iranian nuclear sites.

title: Meal charges for Parliament staff reduced
byline: The House Committee of Parliament has decided to revise the meal charges levied on parliamentary staff, following requests made by staff members.

title: Sri Lanka emphasizes the importance of regional unity and shared progress
byline: Sri Lanka has emphasized the importance of regional unity and shared progress, a crucial factor for South Asia.

title: Iran warns US strikes on nuclear sites will have ‘everlasting consequences’
byline: Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi said Sunday that the U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities were “outrageous” and “will have everlasting consequences.”

title: No Sri Lankans injured in Israel despite drone strikes by Iran
byline: No Sri Lankans have been injured during the past 24 hours in Israel despite a series of drone attacks by Iran, the Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel confirmed.

title: Europeans seek ‘digital sovereignty’ as US tech firms embrace Trump
byline: At a market stall in Berlin run by charity Topio, volunteers help people who want to purge their phones of the influence of U.S. tech firms. Since Donald Trump’s inauguration, the queue for their services has grown.

title: UN Human Rights Chief to arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow (23).

title: Sri Lanka Army issues clarification on information shared on social media
byline: A statement has been issued concerning information being circulated on social media relating to the Sri Lanka Army.

title: Israel recovers bodies of two hostages and soldier from Gaza
byline: The bodies of two Israeli hostages and a soldier have been recovered from the Gaza Strip, Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said.

title: Airlines keep avoiding Middle East airspace after US attack on Iran
byline: Airlines continued to avoid large parts of the Middle East on Sunday (Jun 22) after the United States strikes on Iranian nuclear sites, according to flight tracking website FlightRadar24, with traffic already skirting airspace in the region due to recent missile exchanges.

title: Houthis threaten to attack Red Sea shipping after US strikes on Iran
byline: The US strike on Iran fuelled fears that Israel’s war with Tehran could escalate to a broader regional conflict. Adding more pressure to the situation, Yemen’s Houthi rebels have said that they would attack Red Sea shipping after Trump claimed the US has ‘obliterated’ Iran’s nuclear facilities.

title: Iranian FM to travel to Moscow to ‘coordinate positions’ with Putin
byline: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi, responding to a question from a Russian outlet, said he’ll travel to Moscow today to meet with President Vladimir Putin, after the US struck Iranian nuclear sites.

title: SLBFE to amend registration procedure for self-directed overseas employment
byline: A new amendment will be made to the procedure for Sri Lankans seeking employment abroad through self-directed means to obtain registration with the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), according to the Chairman of the SLBFE, Kosala Wickramasinghe.

title: China ‘strongly condemns’ US strikes on Iran: Foreign Ministry
byline: China’s foreign ministry said on Sunday it “strongly condemns” US strikes on Iran’s nuclear sites, adding that they “escalate tensions in the Middle East”.

title: US urges China to dissuade Iran from closing Strait of Hormuz
byline: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Sunday called on China to encourage Iran to not shut down the Strait of Hormuz after Washington carried out strikes on Iranian nuclear sites.

title: Special announcement for Sri Lankans in Israel
byline: In view of the current situation in Israel, the Government of India has agreed to provide a limited number of seats on Indian Airlines flights operating from Amman, Jordan to New Delhi, India, for those wishing to travel to Sri Lanka, the Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel said in a statement.
